title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: This recipe makes approximately 24 cookies and is perfect for anyone with a sweet tooth. The cookies are soft, chewy, and packed with chocolatey goodness.
steps:
1. Slowly heat up the 150 grams of cane sugar and 150 grams of water for about 10 minutes until it reaches 240 degrees Celsius. Add the pecans and stir until the sugar crystallizes. Continue to stir until the sugar melts again and coats the pecans. Spread the pecans on a sheet pan and bake at 175 degrees Celsius for 10 minutes. Let cool and chop into small pieces. 
2. Melt butter and smoke it according to the description above. Make sure to cool to room temperature before mixing batter. While you’re at it, smoke the Maldon Sea Salt as well. 
3. Combine baking powder, baking soda, salt and flour in a bowl. Whisk together to evenly distribute the leavening. 
4. In the bowl of a standing mixer, combine both sugars with the cooled melted butter. Mix on low speed with the paddle attachment until fully combined. 
5. Add eggs, yolks and vanilla and mix until combined. 
6. Add the dry ingredients in two or three additions. Mix only until the dry ingredients are incorporated. Add chocolate pieces and mix just until spread throughout. 
7. Using a 3-ounce scoop, scoop the dough onto a parchment-lined cookie sheet. Chill, or even better freeze for 24 hours, on the sheet or transfer to a freezer bag for longer-term storage. 
8. To bake: Preheat oven to 150 degrees Celsius. 
9. Place frozen scooped cookies onto a parchment-lined sheet pan with at least two inches of space all around them. 
10. Top with smoked Maldon Sea Salt. 
11. Bake until golden brown, and the center of the cookie looks set and no longer wet. About 23-28 minutes for 85-gram frozen dough balls. Less baking time will be needed if baking from refrigerated, fresh or smaller-sized cookies.

title: Apple Pie
description: This classic apple pie recipe is the perfect dessert for any occasion. The buttery crust and sweet, spiced apple filling will leave your taste buds happy.

ingredients.name: Unsalted butter, chilled and cut into pieces
Mixed apples, peeled, cored, and cut into 1/2-inch thick slices

steps:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and sugar. Add the chilled butter and use a pastry blender or your fingers to cut the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 
2. Gradually add ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing until the dough comes together. Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a disk. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. 
3. Preheat the oven to 375°F. 
4. In a large bowl, toss the sliced apples with the granulated sugar, brown sugar, lemon juice, salt, cinnamon, and cornstarch. 
5. Roll out one disk of dough on a lightly floured surface to fit a 9-inch pie dish. Transfer the dough to the pie dish and trim the edges. 
6. Add the apple mixture to the pie dish. 
7. Roll out the second disk of dough on a lightly floured surface and cut into strips. Place the strips over the filling in a lattice pattern. 
8. Brush the beaten egg over the lattice crust and sprinkle with raw sugar. 
9. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly. 
10. Let cool for at least 30 minutes before serving.

title: Blueberry Galette
description: This rustic blueberry galette is a delicious dessert perfect for any occasion. The buttery crust and sweet blueberry filling will leave your taste buds happy.

ingredients.name: Unsalted butter, chilled and cut into pieces

steps:
1. In a food processor, pulse the flour, sugar, and salt until combined. Add the chilled butter and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal with a few pea-size pieces of butter remaining. 
2. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Drizzle with 1/4 cup ice water and mix with a fork, adding more ice water by the tablespoonful as needed, just until a shaggy dough comes together. Lightly knead until no dry spots remain (do not overwork). 
3. Flatten the dough into a disk and wrap in plastic. Chill for at least 2 hours. 
4. Preheat the oven to 400°F and place a rack in the lower third of the oven. 
5. In a large bowl, toss the blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and lemon zest. 
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a 12-inch circle. Transfer the dough to a parchment-lined baking sheet. 
7. Arrange the blueberry mixture in the center of the dough, leaving a 2-inch border. 
8. Fold the edges of the dough over the filling, pleating as necessary. 
9. Brush the beaten egg over the edges of the dough and sprinkle with raw sugar. 
10. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling. 
11. Let cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.

title: Peach Cobbler
description: This rustic peach cobbler is a delicious dessert perfect for any occasion. The buttery crust and sweet peach filling will leave your taste buds happy.

ingredients.name: Peaches, halved, pitted, and cut into 1cm wedges
Unsalted butter, chilled and cut into pieces

steps:
1. Preheat oven to 190°C and place a rack in the lower third of the oven. 
2. Toss peaches, granulated sugar, brown sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, lemon zest, cinnamon, cardamom, and salt in a large bowl to combine. Transfer to a 2-qt. baking dish.
3. Whisk flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and cardamom in a medium bowl. Add butter and toss to coat. Using your fingers or a pastry blender, work butter into flour until only pea-size pieces remain. Add cream and gently mix until a shaggy dough forms.
4. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a 12-inch circle. Transfer the dough to the top of the peach filling, tucking in the edges around the filling.
5. Brush the beaten egg over the edges of the dough and sprinkle with raw sugar.
6. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling./n7. Let cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.

title: Blueberry Muffins
description: These blueberry muffins are soft, fluffy, and full of juicy blueberry goodness. They're finished with a sweet crunchy cinnamon streusel on a super high muffin top.

ingredients.name: Unsalted butter, chilled and cut into pieces

steps:
1. Preheat oven to 375°. Line a standard 12-cup muffin pan with paper liners. Make the streusel: Whisk flour, brown sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Add butter and rub in with your fingers until mixture is crumbly. Set streusel aside.
2. Make the muffins: Whisk flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl. Whisk brown sugar, butter, egg, buttermilk, and vanilla in a large bowl. Whisk in dry ingredients, then fold in blueberries.
3. Divide batter among muffin cups and sprinkle streusel on top. Bake muffins until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean, 25–30 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack and let muffins cool in pan 5 minutes. Transfer muffins to rack and let cool completely.

title: Victoria Sponge Cake with Chiffon Sponge
description: This Victoria Sponge Cake with Chiffon Sponge is a light and fluffy cake that's perfect for any occasion. The chiffon sponge adds a delicate texture to the classic Victoria sponge recipe. Sandwiched together with fresh cream and strawberry jam, this cake is a British classic.
steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 170°C (325°F). Grease and flour two 8-inch cake pans.
2. In a large mixing bowl, sift together the cake flour, baking powder, salt, and 200 g granulated sugar.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, egg yolks, and water. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until frothy. Add the cream of tartar and continue to beat until soft peaks form. Gradually add 50 g granulated sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.
5. Fold the beaten egg whites into the cake batter until no white streaks remain.
6. Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans and smooth the tops with a spatula.
7. Bake the cakes for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of each cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cakes to cool completely in the pans before removing them.
9. Spread the strawberry jam over the top of one cake layer and then top with sliced strawberries. Spread the whipped cream over the strawberries.
10. Place the second cake layer on top of the whipped cream and gently press down.
11. Dust the top of the cake with powdered sugar, if desired, and serve.

title: Carrot Cake Cupcakes
description: These Carrot Cake Cupcakes are a delicious twist on the classic carrot cake. With a moist and tender crumb, these cupcakes are loaded with freshly grated carrots, warm spices, and chopped pecans, and topped with a rich and creamy cream cheese frosting.
steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg.
3. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.
4. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the grated carrots and chopped pecans.
6. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
7. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.
9. To make the cream cheese frosting, beat the cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, vanilla extract, and heavy cream together until smooth and creamy.
10. Frost the cooled cupcakes with the cream cheese frosting. Serve and enjoy!

title: Tiramisu
description: This version of the classic Italian dessert is made with mascarpone cheese, ladyfingers, and no alcohol. It's a delicious and creamy dessert that's perfect for any occasion.
steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese until smooth.
2. In a separate bowl, beat the halal heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
3. Fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone cheese until well combined.
4. In a shallow dish, mix the instant coffee with hot water and sugar until dissolved.
5. Quickly dip the halal ladyfingers in the coffee mixture, being careful not to soak them for too long.
6. Layer the ladyfingers in the bottom of a 9x13 inch dish.
7. Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
8. Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and remaining mascarpone mixture.
9. Sift cocoa powder over the top of the tiramisu.
10. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
11. Serve chilled.

title: Cinnamin Rolls
description: These cinnamon rolls are soft, fluffy, and full of cinnamon flavor. They're topped with a sweet and tangy cream cheese frosting that's perfect for breakfast or dessert.
steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt.
2. In a small saucepan, heat the milk and butter until the butter is melted.
3. Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and mix until a soft dough forms.
4. Knead the dough for 5 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
5. Place the dough in a greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
6. Punch down the dough and roll it out into a 12x18 inch rectangle.
7. Spread the softened butter over the dough.
8. In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the dough.
9. Roll up the dough tightly, starting from the long side. Cut into 12 equal pieces.
10. Place the rolls in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 30 minutes.
11. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
12. To make the cream cheese frosting, beat the cream cheese and butter together until smooth. Add the powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and milk and mix until well combined.
13. Spread the frosting over the warm cinnamon rolls. Serve and enjoy!

title: Madagascan Vanilla Cheesecake
description: This cheesecake is made with real vanilla beans and has a rich, creamy texture. It's topped with a sweet and tangy raspberry sauce that's perfect for any occasion.
steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
2. In a food processor, pulse the graham crackers until they form fine crumbs. Add the melted butter and pulse until well combined.
3. Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes, then set aside to cool.
4. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sugar and vanilla bean paste and mix until well combined.
5. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
6. Pour the filling over the cooled crust and spread into an even layer.
7. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the center is almost set.
8. Let cool completely, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. To make the raspberry sauce, combine the raspberries, sugar, cornstarch, and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the raspberries break down and the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
10. Let cool completely, then pour over the cheesecake. Serve and enjoy!

title: Devils Food Cake
description: This cake is rich, moist, and chocolatey. It's topped with a creamy chocolate frosting that's perfect for any occasion.
steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add the vanilla extract and mix until well combined.
4. Add the flour mixture in three additions, alternating with the buttermilk. Mix until just combined.
5. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. To make the frosting, beat the butter until smooth. Add the cocoa powder and mix until well combined.
8. Add the powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and milk and mix until smooth and creamy.
9. Frost the cooled cakes and serve.

title: Crumble Churro Cookies
description: These cookies are soft and chewy with a crispy exterior. They're topped with a cinnamon sugar crumble that's perfect for any occasion.
steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla extract and mix until well combined.
4. Add the flour mixture and mix until just combined.
5. In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon and sugar.
6. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls, then roll in the cinnamon sugar mixture. Place on the prepared baking sheet.
7. To make the crumble, combine the melted butter, flour, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Mix until well combined.
8. Sprinkle the crumble over the cookies.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
10. Let cool completely, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. To make the frosting, beat the cream cheese and butter until smooth. Add the powdered sugar and vanilla extract and mix until smooth and creamy.
12. Frost the cooled cookies and serve.
